title: How Technology And Crypto Are Intrinsically Linked
body: Technology and cryptocurrency have become deeply intertwined in the contemporary digital landscape, reshaping industries, challenging traditional financial systems, and offering new opportunities for innovation. This article explores the intricate connection between technology and cryptocurrency, tracing their evolution, examining their impact on society, and envisioning their future prospects. Evolution of Cryptocurrency and Technology The genesis of cryptocurrency can be traced back to the aftermath of the 2008 global financial crisis when a single person or collective using the pseudonym Satoshi Nakamoto launched Bitcoin. Bitcoin pioneered the concept of decentralized digital currency. Built on blockchain technology, Bitcoin introduced a secure, transparent, and immutable ledger system that eliminated the need for intermediaries like banks in financial transactions. As cryptocurrencies continue to evolve, investors are increasingly exploring new coins that promise innovative technologies and potential high returns. Both new and seasoned investors now regularly look for the best crypto to buy today that shows promise of great returns in the future. This trend has led to the emergence of a vibrant market where new projects are launched through Initial Coin Offerings (ICOs) or token sales. These new coins often showcase advancements such as enhanced privacy features, scalability solutions, or novel use cases within decentralized ecosystems. Just like crypto has grown more popular and changed over the years, blockchain technology has also grown. Blockchain, the underlying technology of Bitcoin, operates as a distributed ledger where transactions are recorded across a network of computers. Each transaction is encrypted and added to a “block,” which is then linked to previous blocks, forming a chain of blocks – hence the term “blockchain.” This decentralized and tamper-resistant nature of blockchain technology has extended beyond cryptocurrency to applications in various sectors, including finance, supply chain management, healthcare, and more. Impact of Technology on Crypto Adoption Technological advancements have not only facilitated the adoption of cryptocurrencies but also expanded their utility across various facets of daily life. Today, people can utilize cryptocurrencies for a diverse range of transactions and activities, thanks to innovations in digital platforms and payment systems. Cryptocurrencies have transitioned from speculative assets to viable mediums of exchange for daily purchases. Integration into payment processors and e-commerce platforms enables consumers to buy electronics, clothing, household items, and luxury goods online using digital currencies. Major retailers and online marketplaces increasingly accept cryptocurrencies, providing consumers with diverse options for financial transactions. The travel and hospitality industry has also embraced cryptocurrency payments, allowing travelers to book flights, accommodations, and holiday packages using digital currencies. This flexibility extends to expenses such as car rentals, tours, and activities, catering to individuals seeking convenience and privacy in financial transactions. In the entertainment sector, the emergence of crypto casinos and online gaming platforms has revolutionized gambling. Players can now wager and participate in casino games using cryptocurrencies, offering enhanced security, anonymity, and efficiency compared to traditional payment methods. This expansion underscores cryptocurrencies’ potential to disrupt established industries and meet the demands of a growing audience seeking alternative payment options. Decentralized finance (DeFi) platforms have democratized access to financial services, enabling users to lend, borrow, trade, and earn interest on digital assets without traditional financial intermediaries. Leveraging blockchain technology, DeFi protocols provide open and transparent financial ecosystems accessible directly from digital wallets. The integration of cryptocurrencies into mobile payment solutions has further accelerated their adoption. Mobile apps and digital wallets empower users to securely store, manage, and transact with cryptocurrencies from smartphones, appealing to tech-savvy consumers and younger demographics familiar with digital payment methods. Applications of Blockchain Technology Beyond Cryptocurrency Beyond its role in facilitating financial transactions, blockchain technology has catalyzed innovation across industries. Smart contracts, for instance, are self-executing contracts with terms directly written into code, automating and enforcing contractual agreements without intermediaries. This innovation has profound implications for sectors such as real estate, insurance, and legal services, streamlining processes, reducing costs, and enhancing transparency. In real estate, blockchain-based smart contracts facilitate property transactions by automating payment disbursals upon completion of predefined conditions, thereby eliminating the need for intermediaries and reducing transaction times. Insurance companies utilize smart contracts to automate claims processing, verifying claims against policy terms stored on the blockchain and expediting payouts while minimizing fraud risks. In healthcare, blockchain enables secure management of electronic health records (EHRs), ensuring patient data privacy and interoperability among healthcare providers. Medical professionals can securely access patient records across different healthcare facilities while patients retain control over their sensitive medical information through cryptographic keys. This decentralized approach enhances data security, reduces administrative burdens, and improves patient care coordination. Furthermore, blockchain’s immutability ensures the integrity and accuracy of medical records, mitigating risks associated with data tampering or unauthorized access. Supply chain management also benefits significantly from blockchain’s capabilities. By recording every transaction and movement of goods on an immutable ledger, blockchain enhances transparency and accountability throughout the supply chain. Companies can trace the provenance of products, verify authenticity, and ensure compliance with regulatory standards. This transparency helps in detecting and mitigating issues like counterfeit products, unauthorized substitutions, and supply chain inefficiencies, thereby bolstering consumer trust and operational efficiency. Cryptocurrency and Financial Inclusion Technology and cryptocurrency have significantly contributed to promoting financial inclusion globally. Traditional banking systems often exclude marginalized populations due to stringent requirements and high transaction costs. Cryptocurrencies offer a decentralized financial ecosystem where individuals can access banking services, transfer funds globally at lower fees, and participate in the global economy without relying on intermediaries. In developing countries with limited banking infrastructure, cryptocurrencies provide a lifeline for accessing financial services and participating in e-commerce. Blockchain-based platforms facilitate microfinance initiatives, crowdfunding campaigns, and peer-to-peer lending, empowering individuals to secure loans, invest in businesses, and build financial resilience. Challenges and Regulatory Landscape Despite its transformative potential, the integration of technology and cryptocurrency faces challenges and regulatory scrutiny. Concerns over market volatility, cybersecurity risks, and potential illicit activities have prompted governments and regulatory bodies worldwide to develop frameworks to regulate digital assets. Regulatory clarity is essential to balance innovation with consumer protection, ensuring a safe and stable environment for crypto adoption and investment. Moreover, scalability remains a significant hurdle for blockchain technology, particularly as networks strive to process transactions faster and more efficiently to support mass adoption. Technological advancements such as layer-two solutions and consensus algorithms aim to address scalability issues while maintaining the security and decentralization principles of blockchain networks. Future Outlook and Innovations Looking ahead, the synergy between technology and cryptocurrency is poised to drive further innovation and reshape industries. Emerging technologies like decentralized finance (DeFi) leverage blockchain to create open, permissionless financial services such as lending, borrowing, and trading, bypassing traditional intermediaries. The integration of artificial intelligence (AI) with blockchain technology holds promise for enhancing security, optimizing data management, and automating decision-making processes across various sectors. AI-driven analytics can provide insights into blockchain data, improving operational efficiency and compliance in industries ranging from finance to healthcare. Furthermore, the concept of central bank digital currencies (CBDCs) highlights governments’ interest in leveraging blockchain technology to issue sovereign digital currencies. CBDCs aim to enhance financial inclusion, streamline cross-border payments, and modernize monetary policy frameworks, signaling a significant shift towards digital economies. Conclusion The intricate link between technology and cryptocurrency has catalyzed innovation, disrupted traditional systems, and empowered individuals globally. From its inception with Bitcoin and blockchain to the advent of decentralized applications and beyond, technology continues to redefine how we perceive and engage with financial services. As advancements in technology evolve, cryptocurrencies are poised to play an increasingly integral role in reshaping global commerce and finance, driving innovation, and offering new opportunities for individuals to participate in the digital economy.

title: What Every Day Investors Can Do Now To Prepare For The Future
body: As the investment landscape continues to evolve with technological advancements, economic shifts, and changing market dynamics, it’s essential for everyday investors to prepare effectively for the future. Whether you’re new to investing or a seasoned participant, understanding how to adapt and plan can significantly impact your long-term financial success. Here’s a comprehensive guide on steps everyday investors can take to prepare for the future, focusing on diversification, education, technology adaptation, risk management, and long-term planning. Diversify Your Investment Portfolio Diversification remains one of the most effective strategies for managing risk and achieving long-term financial goals. By spreading investments across different asset classes—such as stocks, bonds, real estate, and commodities—you can reduce the impact of poor performance in any single area. Diversification also extends to different geographic regions and sectors, helping to mitigate risks associated with specific markets or industries. In recent years, alternative investments like cryptocurrencies have gained prominence as a viable option for portfolio diversification. To invest in cryptocurrencies, users can purchase digital assets through online exchanges such as Coinbase, Binance, or Kraken. Once acquired, it’s crucial to store cryptocurrencies securely in a crypto wallet . Wallets come in various forms, including hot wallets (connected to the internet for ease of access) and cold wallets (offline storage for enhanced security). Each type serves to protect your assets from theft or loss while facilitating transactions. Cryptocurrencies present a unique investment opportunity, as they not only have the potential to grow in value but also offer practical uses. Beyond investment, digital currencies can be spent on a variety of goods and services, such as travel, shopping, gaming, and gambling at online casinos . Many businesses and online retailers now accept cryptocurrencies, allowing you to use your digital assets for everyday purchases. This dual benefit of potential appreciation and usability makes cryptocurrencies a compelling addition to a diversified investment portfolio. Embrace Financial Education Continuous learning is crucial for adapting to changing market conditions and making informed investment decisions. Stay updated on financial news, market trends, and economic developments through reputable sources like financial news websites, industry journals, and investment research reports. Additionally, consider taking courses or attending webinars on investment strategies, financial planning, and new technologies in the finance sector. Understanding fundamental concepts such as asset allocation, risk management, and market analysis will enhance your ability to make sound investment decisions. Knowledge about emerging trends, such as sustainable investing or advancements in financial technology, can also provide valuable insights into new opportunities and potential risks. Leverage Technology and Tools Advancements in technology have revolutionized the investment landscape, providing tools and platforms that make investing more accessible and efficient. Online brokerage accounts, robo-advisors , and investment apps offer user-friendly interfaces and automated services that can help manage and grow your investments. Robo-advisors use algorithms to provide personalized investment advice and portfolio management based on your financial goals and risk tolerance. They can be a cost-effective solution for investors looking for automated portfolio management. Additionally, financial apps can track your investments, provide real-time market data, and help you stay on top of your financial goals. Embracing technology also involves understanding the implications of new financial products and services, such as blockchain-based assets or decentralized finance (DeFi) platforms. While these innovations offer exciting possibilities, it’s essential to research and understand their risks and potential impacts on your investment strategy. Develop a Robust Risk Management Strategy Risk management is a critical component of successful investing. As market conditions fluctuate, having a well-defined risk management strategy can help protect your investments and minimize potential losses. Consider diversifying across various asset classes and sectors to spread risk. Additionally, setting stop-loss orders can help limit losses on individual investments by automatically selling assets when they reach a predetermined price. Regularly reviewing and adjusting your investment portfolio based on your risk tolerance and market conditions is also important. Periodic rebalancing ensures that your asset allocation remains aligned with your financial goals and risk appetite. Additionally, maintaining an emergency fund and having adequate insurance coverage can provide a financial safety net in case of unexpected events or market downturns. Focus on Long-Term Financial Goals Investing with a long-term perspective is essential for building wealth and achieving financial goals. Rather than reacting to short-term market fluctuations, focus on your long-term objectives and maintain a disciplined approach. Establish clear financial goals, such as retirement savings, buying a home, or funding education, and develop a plan to achieve them. Regular contributions to retirement accounts like 401(k)s or IRAs, as well as consistent investments in diversified portfolios, can help you build wealth over time. Compounding returns, where earnings generate additional earnings, play a crucial role in long-term investment growth. By staying committed to your financial plan and avoiding impulsive decisions based on short-term market movements, you can increase the likelihood of reaching your goals. Stay Informed About Regulatory Changes Financial regulations and policies can have a significant impact on investment strategies and market dynamics. Staying informed about regulatory changes, tax laws, and investment policies is essential for making informed decisions and optimizing your financial strategy. For example, new tax laws or changes in retirement account regulations can affect your investment returns and planning. Consider consulting with a financial advisor or tax professional to understand how regulatory changes may impact your investment strategy and overall financial plan. Keeping abreast of developments in financial regulations can help you adapt your strategy to comply with new requirements and take advantage of any potential benefits. Adopt Sustainable and Responsible Investing Practices There is a growing trend toward sustainable and responsible investing, where investors seek to align their investments with their values and address environmental, social, and governance (ESG) factors. Sustainable investing focuses on investing in companies and projects that prioritize ethical practices, environmental stewardship, and social responsibility. Incorporating ESG criteria into your investment strategy can not only contribute to a positive societal impact but also offer potential long-term financial benefits. Researching and selecting investments based on ESG factors can help identify companies that are better positioned for future growth and resilience in a changing world. Seek Professional Advice While self-education and independent research are valuable, seeking professional advice can provide additional insights and guidance. Financial advisors, investment managers, and tax professionals can offer personalized recommendations based on your financial situation, goals, and risk tolerance. They can help you navigate complex investment options, develop comprehensive financial plans, and address specific concerns. When choosing a financial advisor, look for professionals with relevant certifications, such as Certified Financial Planners (CFPs) or Chartered Financial Analysts (CFAs), and ensure they have a fiduciary responsibility to act in your best interest. Regular consultations with a trusted advisor can help you stay on track with your financial goals and adapt to changing market conditions.

title: Is Forex Trading Profitable – What Experts Say?
body: The foreign exchange trading, which involves buying and selling of currencies, has gained popularity among investors as a way of making money. Nevertheless, is forex trading profitable? It is still a difficult question that is argued about by most traders and financial analysts. Understanding Forex Trading An agreed exchange rate allows for the exchange of currencies in forex trading. Forex is the biggest financial market in the world by far, and it has a daily trading volume of over $7 trillion. The forex market provides trading hours during the week, around the clock unlike other markets. Therefore, there are enough chances for people who trade all over the world to engage in trading on this market, and with sources like 55brokers , finding a reliable broker based on comprehensive reviews is not a problem. People are attracted to forex trading because it has the potential of providing large profits. By buying cheaply and selling at a higher cost, traders speculate on the changes in the value of one currency in comparison to others. However, trading in the forex market is very risky because of its high volatility and excessive leverage that can result in enormous losses; hence, traders should be well knowledgeable about the market fundamentals as well as risk controlling techniques to exchange currency successfully. Expert Opinions on Forex Trading Profitability To gain a comprehensive view of forex trading profitability, we turn to insights from renowned financial experts. Kathy Lien, Managing Director at BK Asset Management Kathy Lien, a prominent currency strategist and author, brings a nuanced perspective to forex trading, emphasizing the psychological aspects of the market. She notes, “The forex market is a reflection of the collective mindset of millions of traders. Understanding the psychology behind it can give you a significant edge.” Lien highlights that forex trading is not just about numbers and charts; it’s about understanding the emotions and reactions of other market participants. This awareness can help traders anticipate market movements and make more informed decisions. Paul Tudor Jones, Hedge Fund Manager Paul Tudor Jones, a legendary hedge fund manager, offers an inspiring take on the broader aspects of trading success. Known for his macro trading strategies, Jones has often spoken about the importance of discipline, perseverance, and the right mindset. He once remarked, “As I’ve told my three daughters, all of whom I’ve at one time encouraged to go into macro trading, any man or woman can do anything to which they set their heart and mind.” This philosophy extends to forex trading, where Jones believes that success is attainable in forex for those who are willing to commit fully to the process. John J. Murphy, Author and Market Analyst John J. Murphy, a highly respected figure in technical analysis, is known for his profound understanding of market behavior. While his work primarily focuses on stock market analysis, Murphy’s insights are equally applicable to forex trading. He emphasizes the importance of positioning oneself in the right market segments, stating, “One thing that stock investing has in common with real estate is that location is very important. In this case, however, we’re referring to where in the stock market your money is located. Being in the right sectors and industry groups can enhance your overall performance. Being in the wrong ones can hurt it.” Translated to forex, this underscores the significance of understanding currency pairs, their behavior, and market trends to achieve profitability. Factors Influencing Forex Trading Profitability Several factors can impact a trader’s success in the forex market: Market Knowledge: It is important to understand currency pairs, economic indicators and geopolitical events. Traders who stay informed about global economic conditions are better positioned to make profitable forex trading decisions. Risk Management: To protect your trading capital and minimize potential losses, it would be helpful if you applied some risk management measures like setting a stop loss level and controlling leverages. Trading Strategy: It is important to come up with a strong trading plan that suits your risk tolerance and the prevailing market conditions. Such strategies can be based on technical analysis, fundamental analysis or a combination of both. Emotional Control: Emotions are highly involved in forex trading. Traders must keep focused and not make fear-based or greedy spontaneous decisions that would deviate from their plan, resulting in a wrong strategy. Market Conditions : Before understanding is trading forex profitable, consider economic data releases, central bank policies and geopolitical events. If traders keep track of these, they will be able to predict which way the market will move. Expert Recommendations for Aspiring Traders For those new to forex trading or looking to improve their trading skills, experts offer the following recommendations: Educate Yourself: Put your money into a complete forex education. It is important that you understand the basics in the market, different ways of trading and also how risk can be managed; otherwise, there would be no way for you to succeed. Start Small: To minimize the risk of losing money, it is advisable to start with either a demo account or low volume trades. Confidence is boosted and trading capabilities are fine-tuned through this method. Develop a Plan: Develop an elaborate trading plan indicating what you want to achieve, the approaches to be employed as well as the risk control measures. With a good plan in place, one can remain focused and practice in a disciplined manner. Stay Disciplined: Stick to your trading plan and steer clear of impulsive decisions that arise from the short-term market dynamics. Long-term gains can only be made through being consistent and maintaining discipline. Continuous Improvement: Always assess how you are performing in your trade. Follow what is happening in the market, improve your game plan and also ask other skillful traders for some tips that may help you become better. Authors Bio A financial analyst at 55Brokers Crispus Nyaga is highly experienced in the financial markets. With extensive knowledge and experience, Crispus has earned a reputation as a trusted voice in the industry. He excels at translating complex financial terms into actionable insights, making him a valuable resource for traders seeking to understand trading profitability and enhance their trading strategies.

title: Lockheed Martin to Acquire Terran Orbital
body: Lockheed Martin [NYSE: LMT] , a Bethesda, MD-based defense technology company, announced the signing of a definitive agreement to acquire Terran Orbital [NYSE: LLAP], a global provider of satellite-based solutions primarily supporting the aerospace and defense industries. The enterprise value of the transaction is approximately $450m. Lockheed Martin will acquire Terran Orbital for $0.25 in cash for each outstanding share of common stock and retire its existing debt. This transaction also provides for Lockheed Martin and other current Terran Orbital creditors establishing a new, $30m working capital facility that has been put in place as of signing. The transaction is expected to close in fourth quarter of 2024 and is subject to the satisfaction of customary closing conditions, including regulatory and Terran Orbital stockholder approvals. Upon closing, Terran Orbital will remain a commercial merchant supplier to industry. Terran Orbital is a manufacturer of satellite products primarily serving the aerospace and defense industries. It provides end-to-end satellite solutions by combining satellite design, production, launch planning, mission operations, and on-orbit support to meet the needs of  military, civil, and commercial customers. Lockheed Martin is a global security and aerospace company engaged in the research, design, development, manufacture, integration and sustainment of advanced technology systems, products and services. Led by Marc Bell, chairman, CEO, and co-founder, Terran Orbital brings a high throughput, robotic manufacturing capacity and high-performing modular space vehicle designs. Combined with Lockheed Martin’s record of performance and innovation, this transaction will enable a broader range of capabilities and value for customers. Lockheed Martin uses Terran Orbital’s satellites for its work, most notably with the Space Development Agency’s Transport and Tracking Layer programs, and in several of its self-funded technology demonstrations. FinSMEs 16/08/2024

title: Resurgens Technology Partners Closes $800M Third Fund
body: Resurgens Technology Partners , an Atlanta, GA-based private equity firm investing in North American and European lower middle-market software companies, announced the completion of fundraising for its Fund III, securing $800M in commitments. Fund III follows Resurgens’ two prior funds, RTP I, which raised over $200M, and RTP II, which raised over $500M. Similar to predecessor vehicles, Fund III will target majority investments in founder-owned software businesses as well as special situations such as carve-out transactions or venture-backed recapitalizations. RTP III will seek to build a portfolio of a relatively small number of companies which are important players in their market segments. The Resurgens value-creation efforts bring cross-functional capabilities across sales and marketing, product and R&D, talent recruitment and add-on acquisition and integration execution. Led by Co-founders and Managing Directors Fred Sturgis, and Adi Filipovic, Resurgens Technology Partners is a tech-focused private equity firm investing in North American and select European lower middle-market application and infrastructure software businesses. Resurgens’ team of thirty-six professionals offers a diversity of investing, operating and talent management experience, applying an active and engaged value creation approach with each portfolio company. Resurgens is headquartered in Atlanta, with additional professionals located in Austin, Boston, London and the Bay Area. FinSMEs 16/08/2024

title: The Impact of Fintech on Payday Loans: Revolutionizing Short-Term Lending
body: Imagine tapping your phone a few times and getting financial help. This is not some kind of distant future; it is happening today thanks to various advances in fintech. 1F Cash Advance is one of the companies at the forefront of this revolution. This service is changing what we think of payday loans today. They have made getting a loan fast, simple, and hassle-free—not a single inconvenience from the past. Now, let’s explore how fintech services can impact the entire industry. Overview of Payday Loans Payday loans are products that help cover unexpected expenses very fast. They usually offer small sums of up to $1,000, have high interest rates, and need to be repaid in 2 to 4 weeks. They may be useful in urgent needs but are often criticized due to high costs and unfavorable terms that lead the borrower into a debt trap. Traditional applications for payday loans always go along with carefully choosing a lender, determining qualifications, and collecting documents. It is long and tedious. That’s why this method often causes a lot of inconvenience, even though it allows people to get money quickly. Fintech: The Game Changer Unlike traditional payday lenders, fintech companies apply modern technology to make the financial services faster, safer, and more convenient. It covers various services, from digital payment to automated lending and insurance. Here are innovators who paved the way: 1F Cash Advance: The platform makes payday lending simple and fast. Now, you can apply for a loan online without leaving your home and wasting time on paperwork and personal visits. The application can be approved in just a few minutes, and the money can be credited to your bank account within 24 hours. What sets 1F Cash Advance apart is their verification methods that evaluate an applicant’s overall financial situation rather than just their credit score. This makes the company’s products available to a broader range of customers, including those with bad credit. Affirm : It’s a modern way to finance purchases—buy what you need now and pay later with clear, no-surprise, no-hidden-fees payment plans. Affirm provides clear terms upfront so customers know precisely what they’ll have to pay from the start. The company prides itself on offering transparency and fairness to ensure there are no surprises hidden in fine print. ZestFinance : This company aims to transform lending into a more accessible and fair process through big data and machine learning. With vast data points for analysis, ZestFinance can accurately determine a borrower’s creditworthiness outside traditional credit scores. This reduces the risk for lenders and makes it possible to offer opportunities to people who may be overlooked by traditional banks. The Bright Side of Fintech-Driven Payday Loans Financial technologies, or fintech, have made our finances easier and more accessible. New solutions have made money management faster, more convenient, and safer. Unprecedented accessibility. The availability of various forms of fintech indeed makes financial services more accessible and convenient. Not long ago, going to the bank and standing in line to manage your finances was necessary. Nowadays, any smartphone owner can solve financial issues without leaving their homeroom. People can easily pay bills, transfer money, and even take out loans lying on their couches. Transparency that creates trust. Fintech services simply lay down all the terms and costs associated with their loans upfront. They assist the borrower with full information on interest, payments, and terms so he can make informed decisions. There are no surprise payments. This makes the lending process transparent and reliable. Efficiency like never before. Fintech apps can speed up loan processing. What used to take a lot of time is now done within minutes with the infusion of modern technology and automation. This becomes important, especially when money is urgently needed, and every minute counts. Challenges in the Fintech Landscape Financial technology is evolving rapidly, which often makes it difficult to comply with old regulations. Any fintech company must balance implementing new ideas with compliance per all legal requirements, which may be challenging and time-consuming. Although ease of access to financial services is convenient on the one hand, it may push people to take out more loans than they can comfortably repay, leading them into a debt trap. Therefore, fintech companies need to be responsible and create ethical practices that safeguard customers from unnecessary debt. Digital technology may also be inconvenient to the older generation. People’s inability to use the Internet or modern devices can hold them back from taking out fintech loans. Therefore, companies should work on making their services straightforward, user-friendly, and convenient to everyone regardless of their skills. The Path Forward in Fintech Lending Fintech has truly revolutionized payday lending. With the advent of fintech companies, lending has become more accessible and fair while solving financial problems fast and hassle-free. Today, fintech is making payday loans a useful financial tool with new opportunities and choices presented to users. However, several steps still need to be taken in the areas of regulation, accessibility, and responsible lending and borrowing.

title: Zircuit Closes Mainnet Funding Round
body: Zircuit , a ZK rollup with AI-enabled sequencer-level security and parallelized circuits, closed its Mainnet funding round. Arcanum Capital made the latest investment in a round also including Binance Labs, Mirana, and Nomad Capital, among other investors in previous rounds including Pantera Capital, Dragonfly, and Arthur Hayes’ Maelstrom. The company intends to use the funds to help improve blockchain security to prevent smart contract exploits. Led by Martin Derka, Zircuit is an EVM-compatible zero-knowledge rollup, integrating elements of both optimistic rollups and zero-knowledge (zk) proofs to optimize transaction processing and validation capabilities. Built by a team of web3 security veterans and PhDs in computer science, algorithms, and cryptography, Zircuit recently launched its Public Testnet, attracting $3.5B of TVL in three months. FinSMEs 16/08/2024

title: Drift Energy Closes £4.65M Seed Financing
body: Drift Energy , a Bath, UK-based startup set to make green energy at sea using hi-tech sailing vessels, raised £4.65m in seed funding. The round was led by Octopus Ventures, with participation from Blue Action Accelerator. The company intends to use the funds to bolster its vessel design program, support team growth and enable the onboarding of new partners. Led by CEO and Founder Ben Medland, Drift Energy is committed to driving the transition to clean energy worldwide by deploying a fleet of high-performance sailing vessels that harness deep ocean wind to produce green hydrogen at sea and deliver it globally. The company has also recently been awarded funding from Innovate UK, the UK’s innovation agency, through its Investor Partnership Programme, which is designed to drive investment into high-growth, innovative UK companies working on technology. The grant will catalyse the research and development programme and accelerate the design process of the first vessel. FinSMEs 16/08/2024

title: Hadrian Acquires Datum Source
body: Hadrian , a Torrance, CA-based advanced manufacturing company, acquired Datum Source, a Newport Beach, California-based provider of a procurement management Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) platform and manufacturing network. The amount of the deal was not disclosed. Founded by Rob Pakalski, Thomas Cobbs, and Ryan Nagle, three SpaceX supply chain experts, Datum is a venture-backed startup dedicated to automating, simplifying, and improving supply chain operations for advanced hardware startups. Over the past years, it has collaborated with hardware innovators, offering two key product solutions: part-sourcing services and procure-to-pay software, which streamline supply chain processes, enhancing efficiency and reliability for their clients. Datum’s software is utilized by various hardware companies, including Apex, Saronic, Muon Space, Impulse Space, Radiant Nuclear, H3X Technologies, Source Energy, and Reliable Robotics, for their internal procurement operations. Led by Founder and CEO Chris Power, Hadrian helps the U.S. industrial and manufacturing base scale by improving the American worker with process engineering, AI, Machine Learning, and robotics. It aims to transform the U.S. industrial base by building a series of highly automated precision component factories to enable space and defense manufacturers to get parts faster and halve the cost of making rockets, satellites, jets, and drones. Hadrian scales advanced machining to support customers in space, transportation, and defense. The acquisition closed on July 8. FinSMEs 15/08/204

title: Mesh Receives Strategic Investment From QuantumLight
body: Mesh , a San Francisco, CA-based modern connectivity layer for crypto that makes payments and deposits, received a strategic investment from QuantumLight. The amount of the deal was not disclosed. The investment values Mesh at triple the pre-money valuation of its Series A following growth since the start of 2024. Led by CEO Bam Azizi, Mesh aims to build an open, connected, and secure crypto ecosystem. The product, which has already been implemented by the likes of MetaMask, MoonPay, and Fireblocks, enables users to connect, deposit, and pay with their crypto accounts across hundreds of other platforms, all embedded within their existing experience. It has over 300 integrations available. As the modern connectivity layer for crypto, it allows new use cases such as crypto payments and payouts, deposits, on and off-ramping, transfers, and more within a unified platform. The company has raised $45M+ to date from PayPal Ventures, Money Forward, Galaxy, Samsung Next, and other VCs and angel investors like Gokul Rajaram. FinSMEs 16/08/2024

title: Clevenio Raises Pre-Seed Funding Round
body: Clevenio , a Jyväskylä, Finland-based B2B SaaS company, raised an undisclosed amount in Pre-Series B funding. The round was led by Gorilla Capital, with participation from Sofokus Ventures. The company intends to use the funds to accelerate the development of their product for larger markets. Led by CEO Aleksi Halsas, Clevenio is a B2B SaaS company providing a platform for B2B sales teams to automate list building and account research. The company serves clients in the Nordics, especially in Finland. FinSMEs 16/08/2024

title: Amount Raises $30M in Equity Funding
body: Amount , a Chicago, IL-based provider of a digital origination and decisioning SaaS platform, raised $30M in equity funding. The round was led by Curql with participation from Goldman Sachs, WestCap, Hanaco, and QED Investors. The company intends to use the funds to further invest in its technology and accelerate its progress in the credit union sector, to enhance its current artificial intelligence and machine learning capabilities. Led by CEO Adam Hughes, Amount is a global digital origination and decisioning SaaS platform powering high-velocity consumer and SMB origination for financial institutions. Developed by experts, it helps banks and credit unions drive profitability and achieve a performance advantage with an integrated platform which leverages enterprise bank-grade infrastructure and compliance. With it, banks and credit unions can optimize performance across product categories while tapping into various service offerings including customer acquisition, funnel and performance assessments, and risk analytics. Amount clients include financial institutions collectively managing just over $3.1T in US assets and servicing more than 50 million U.S. consumers. As a partner to banks like Fifth Third Bank, as well as major card networks such as Mastercard, in 2022, Amount announced a partnership with the largest credit union service organization in the country, Velera (formerly PSCU), to provide digital credit card origination solutions for its clients. Earlier this year, the company strengthened its partnership with Velera when the latter announced the launch of its new digital lending suite, Origination Solutions. FinSMEs 15/08/2024

title: SAM Acquires Theorem Geo
body: SAM , an Austin, TX-based provider of spatial data collection for decision support, serving utilities, transportation, and infrastructure-focused clients, announced the acquisition of Theorem Geo, a Charlotte, NC-based company deploying technology platforms and consulting services for utilities and government organizations. The amount of the deal was not disclosed. This acquisition strengthens SAM’s Managed Geospatial Services™ (MGS™) offerings for the electric utility market. Led by Founder and CEO John Eddins, Theorem Geo is a company deploying technology platforms and consulting services to solve complex problems for utilities and government entities. Their expertise will join SAM’s Managed Geospatial Services™ business unit, focusing on advancing data acquisition, improving analysis, and developing predictive analytics. Led by CEO Sam Shakir, SAM is a provider of spatial data for decision support, serving utilities, transportation, and infrastructure-focused clients. As an advanced professional Managed Geospatial Service ™ firm, SAM uses advanced technology to capture and analyze infrastructure and environmental conditions at speed and accuracy, providing its partners with business insights that ensure the safety, sustainability, and reliability of critical infrastructure. FinSMEs 16/08/2024

title: Franklin Venture Partners Closes Latest Fundraising Round
body: Franklin Venture Partners, the private investing platform of San Mateo, CA-based Franklin Templeton’s Franklin Equity Group, closed its second enterprise technology growth equity fund. The fund is primarily focused on mid- to late-stage venture companies in the enterprise technology space that appear to be positioned for an initial public offering (IPO). The team’s second vintage vehicle received support from a mix of investors, including institutions, family offices and high net worth individuals. Led by Ryan Biggs, James Cross and Robert Stevenson, Franklin Venture Partners invests in private companies it believes are poised to have a transformative impact across multiple industries. With more than $3 Billion deployed across 95 companies since 2014, the team manages private equity funds focused on a growing number of high-growth categories, including industrial, enterprise, space and defense technology. The team offers in-depth expertise in managing global, U.S. and sector-specific strategies at Franklin Templeton. FinSMEs 16/08/2024

title: Caresyntax Raises $180M in Series C Funding
body: Caresyntax , a San Francisco, CA-based provider of a vendor-neutral precision surgery platform, raised $180M in Series C funding. The financing comprises $80M of equity and up to $100M of growth debt facility. Backers included Symbiotic Capital, MTIP AG, BIONIQ Capital, PFM Health Sciences, Pictet Alternative Advisors, surgical.ai, BlackRock Innovation Capital, Aescuvest, Optum Ventures, Cure Capital, Relyens Group, Vesalius Biocapital, Lauxera Capital, Plug & Play Growth Fund, and ProAssurance Corp. The company intends to use the funds to expand operations and its development efforts. Led by CEO Dennis Kogan, Caresyntax offers a vendor-neutral, precision surgery platform that delivers actionable insights to improve patient outcomes. Its proprietary software and AI platform is capturing and analyzing large volumes of video, audio, images, device data, clinical and operational data in and around the OR. The software and automation platform can be used by the care team live, during a procedure, and accessed by those outside the operating room via secured dedicated cloud and telehealth links. The platform provides meta-data insights and real-world evidence (RWE) that help surgeons and teams to improve their care, hospital administrators to use resources more efficiently, and medical device companies to advance products. It also supports insurance companies to understand and control risks, as well as enable contracts on value-based model. Caresyntax serves over 30,000 surgical professionals across more than 3,000 operating rooms worldwide, delivering automation and actionable insights to hospitals, medical device companies and insurance groups. FinsMEs 15/08/2024
